security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown templates and review guidelines. All 74 static findings are false positives triggered by example code snippets in documentation. The skill contains no executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. It provides structured prompts to guide AI code review sessions.

content.user_title: Review code for quality and security issues
content.value_statement: Code reviews catch bugs and security vulnerabilities before they reach production. This skill provides structured guidance for thorough code reviews with prioritized actionable feedback.
actual_capabilities: Analyze code changes and identify modifications using git diff
Detect security vulnerabilities including exposed secrets and injection risks
Evaluate code quality, readability, and maintainability
Identify performance issues and optimization opportunities
Check compliance with project conventions and best practices
Provide prioritized feedback organized by severity levels
limitations: Does not execute code or run automated tests
Requires user to provide code context or file contents
Cannot access external repositories or files independently
Relies on AI model capabilities and training data

use_cases.title: Pre-merge pull request reviews
use_cases.description: Review code changes before merging to catch bugs, security issues, and quality problems early in development cycle

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability assessments
use_cases.description: Identify exposed secrets, SQL injection risks, XSS vulnerabilities, and authentication flaws in application code

use_cases.title: Code quality standards enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure new code meets project conventions, follows best practices, and maintains architectural consistency

prompt_templates.title: Basic code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the recent code changes in this branch

prompt_templates.title: Security focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this file for security issues, exposed secrets, and authentication problems

prompt_templates.title: Specific file review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review src/auth.js for security vulnerabilities, code quality issues, and maintainability problems

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive pull request review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a thorough code review of all changes in this pull request. Check for security issues, code quality problems, performance bottlenecks, and best practice violations. Organize findings by severity with specific line numbers and fix recommendations.

best_practices: Provide specific file paths and line numbers in review requests for focused analysis
Request security review before merging code that handles authentication or sensitive data
Use the checklist format to ensure comprehensive coverage across security, quality, and performance
anti_patterns: Requesting reviews without providing the actual code or diff to analyze
Ignoring critical security findings and merging vulnerable code anyway
Using generic review requests without specifying focus areas or priority concerns

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides structured prompts to guide AI code review sessions with organized feedback.

faq.question: What types of security issues can it detect?
faq.answer: It identifies hardcoded secrets, SQL injection risks, XSS vulnerabilities, missing authentication, insecure input handling, and exposed API keys.

faq.question: Does this skill execute code or run tests?
faq.answer: No, it analyzes code structure and patterns through static review. It does not execute code, run tests, or access external systems.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No, the skill operates within your AI session. Code is processed by the AI model you are using without external network calls.

faq.question: Why are no issues found in my review?
faq.answer: Ensure you provide the actual code, file contents, or git diff. The AI needs code context to analyze. Try being more specific about files and concerns.

faq.question: How does this differ from automated linting tools?
faq.answer: This provides human-like judgment on design patterns, architecture decisions, and contextual security advice that static analysis tools typically miss.
